panels.content: Data for $host with $interval resolution

If no graphs are populated, please follow instruction on how to enable the extension dblink and create a custom query.
The dashboard won't work until these steps are executed.

targets.expr:
avg by () ((rate(pg_stat_database_tup_deleted{instance="$host",datname=~"$db"}[$interval]) or
irate(pg_stat_database_tup_deleted{instance="$host",datname=~"$db"}[5m])) +
(rate(pg_stat_database_tup_inserted{instance="$host",datname=~"$db"}[$interval]) or
irate(pg_stat_database_tup_inserted{instance="$host",datname=~"$db"}[5m])) +
(rate(pg_stat_database_tup_updated{instance="$host",datname=~"$db"}[$interval]) or
irate(pg_stat_database_tup_updated{instance="$host",datname=~"$db"}[5m])) + 
(rate(pg_stat_database_tup_fetched{instance="$host",datname=~"$db"}[$interval]) or
irate(pg_stat_database_tup_fetched{instance="$host",datname=~"$db"}[5m])) + 
(rate(pg_stat_database_tup_returned{datname=~"$db",instance="$host"}[$interval]) or
irate(pg_stat_database_tup_returned{datname=~"$db",instance="$host"}[5m])))
